New Records: Georgia extended their fifth consecutive unbeaten streak in Tbilisi and secured their fifth consecutive win in the Nations League
Key Match Events: Georgia scored four goals with Giorgi Chakvetadze contributing two goals and one assist
Czech Republic scored one goal with Lukas Kalvach netting the consolation goal
Ivan Hasek was substituted early due to injury and Matej Rynes also left the field injured
Pre-Game Insights: Georges Mikautadze was awarded for his top-scoring performance at Euro 2024, but the Czech Republic showed no interest in niceties against their promoted opponents
Post-Match Reflections: Czech Republic followed up their worst Euros as an independent nation with a fifth consecutive Nations League defeat
Georgia started their Nations League campaign strongly with a perfect start in their first second-tier campaign
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match stats were highlighted by Georgia's dominance and Chakvetadze's Man of the Match performance
The article referenced the use of Flashscore for detailed statistics and player ratings
